table.name: ie_ss_stop
table.description: The IE series of tables is a method to store the EDI information from a Blob into a more relational format. However these may change in ver 3.0.

columns.name: I_REC_NO
columns.description: The record number primary key identifier for the tracking event specified.

columns.name: I_TRANSACTION_NO
columns.description: The transaction identifier for the shipment data of the tracking event.

columns.name: STOP_SEQUENCE
columns.description: The stop sequence associated with the stop if a shipment identifier is entered and stop tracking event is for an existing stop.

columns.name: PORT_LOCATION_FUNCTION_CODE
columns.description: The port location function code for ocean tracking events.

columns.name: LOCATION_REFNUM_QUAL_GID
columns.description: The location reference number quantifier associated with a location reference number if supplied on the tracking event.

columns.name: LOCATION_ID_VALUE
columns.description: The location reference value associated with the reference number qualifier.

columns.name: LOCATION_NAME
columns.description: A location name if supplied with the tracking event.

columns.name: EVENT_CITY
columns.description: The city associated with the tracking event.

columns.name: EVENT_STATE
columns.description: The state associated with the tracking event.

columns.name: EVENT_COUNTRY
columns.description: The country associated with the tracking event.

columns.name: SPLC_CODE
columns.description: If the tracking stop is for a rail location the Standard Point Location Code (SPLC) can be used.

columns.name: LATITUDE
columns.description: A latitude and longitude value for a stop level tracking event can be supplied instead of a location based event.

columns.name: LONGITUDE
columns.description: A latitude and longitude value for a stop level tracking event can be supplied instead of a location based event.

columns.name: TERMINAL_NAME
columns.description: The terminal name for port associated with the tracking event status.

columns.name: GATE_PIER_DOOR_NUMBER
columns.description: The gate pier door number assigned to the shipment tracking status.

columns.name: TIME_ZONE_GID
columns.description: The time zone identifier for the tracking event.

columns.name: EVENTDATE
columns.description: The tracking event date.

columns.name: AEI_INDICATOR
columns.description: The AEI indicator for the tracking event.

columns.name: PARTITION_KEY
columns.description: The monthly range partition to manage purging status messages.

columns.name: REFERENCE_POSITION
columns.description: The position of this stop relative to the yet-to-be-created new stop.

columns.name: STOP_TYPE
columns.description: The stop type for the new stop created with tracking event.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Typically a location GID is not supplied on a stop tracking event if you have entered the stop sequence number. If adding an additional stop to the shipment, this field together with the reference position is required.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: ERPC
columns.description: If the tracking stop is for a rail location the Eastern Railroad President's Conference (ERPC) can be used.
